Name: zi jiang
Common: Indonesian: Panglai (Sunda), bengle (Jawa), pandhiyang (Madura); mugle, bungle, baglai, baniai, banglai, bunglai; bangle; kunit bolai, kunyit bolai (Sumatera); banggele (Bali); bale, panini, manglai, manguiai, bangerei, wangelei, walegai; kukuniran, kukundiren, unin makei, unin pakei; bongle
Other name: ka sa meng na jiang 卡薩蒙納薑

Maladies Treated: pain due to inflammation of the ears, throat, and nose
shrinking abdomen after giving birth (Indonesian folk medicine)
Samples of Formulae: For inflammation of the mucous membrane of the eye: zi jiang (Cassumunar ginger rhizome) 15 g and jiang huang (Turmeric) 15 g and Cumin 13 pieces. Wash and cut into pieces as needed. Boil with 1 cup water and render till half a cup is left. After the decoction has cooled down, filter and take orally.
Contraindications:
Avoid mixing this herb with warfarin, hypertension drugs or cholesterol drugs. [2]
避免與抗凝血素香豆素或與治血壓高西藥，或降膽固醇西藥同用。
Research:
Anti-inflammatory effect of Zingiber cassumunar Roxb. and its active principles.
Zingiber cassumunar rhizome showed more than 30% increase of CYP3A4 inhibition [1]
Inhibits cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2)
http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1312247/table/TU1/
Notes:
CYP3A4: an enzyme that makes up part of the liver’s cytochrome P450 system. P450 is a system that metabolizes drugs and other foreign substances in the liver by means of enzymes (e.g., CYP3A4) that inhibit or promote metabolic reactions.
cyclooxygenase-2, Cox-2 is an enzyme that makes prostaglandins that cause inflammation and pain and fever.
Original Text:
Zingiber purpureum Roscoe, Complementary and Alternative Healing University
Complementary and Alternative Healing University

mugle, bengle, bungle, baglai, baniai, banglai, bunglai,; bangle, kunit bolai, kunyit bolai (Sumatera), banggele (Bali),; bale, panini, manglai, manguiai, bangerei, wangelei, walegai,; kukuniran, kukundiren, unin makei, unin pakei, bangle, bongleDistribution:產地﹕Tropical Asia: India, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia, Yunnan province of China etc.Properties(characteristics)﹕性味﹕fragrant, slightly spicy, slightly bitter.香，微辛，微苦。Channels (meridians) entered: 歸經﹕liver, spleen and lung.肝﹐脾﹐肺經。Medical functions:藥理﹕anti-inflammatory effect抗炎Actions & Indications:主治﹕For pain relief after surgery; muscle pain, painful menstruation, pain due to inflammation of the ears, throat, and nose, as antipyretics. Usage in Indonesian folk medicine: for treatment of fever, headache, cough, stomachache, common cold, constipation; jaundice, worm parasites, rheumatism, obesity; for shrinking abdomen after giving birth and as tonic. 抗風濕、抗發炎、鎮痛解熱。常用於手術後疼痛控制、消炎、肌肉疼痛，經痛，耳鼻喉發炎引起的疼痛。 印尼民間用於治療發熱，頭痛，咳嗽，胃痛，感冒，便秘，黃疸，寄生蟲，風濕，肥胖; 作生完孩子後之食補，產後收縮腹部。Chemical ingredients:化學 成份﹕sabinene 27-34% G-terpinene 6-8% α-terpinene 4-5% terpinene-4-ol 30-35% E-1-(3,4-dimethoxyphenyl)butadiene as DMPBD 12-19%resin, starch, tannin. 檜27-34％ G-松油烯（g-不旋松油精) 6-8％ a-萜烯4-5％ 萜品烯-4 - 醇的30-35％的 E-1-（3,4 - 二甲氧基苯基）丁二烯，即 DMPBD12-19％樹脂，澱粉，單寧。Dosage:用量﹕15 g (fresh root)Samples of formulae:處方舉例﹕For treatment of: Inflammation of the mucous membrane of the eye: zi jiang and jiang huang  15 g each and Cumin13 pieces of  , washed and cut into pieces as needed. Boiled with 1 cup water and render till half a cup is left. After the decoction has cooling down, filter and take orally..眼睛的粘膜發炎症： 紫姜，姜黃各15克，孜然13枚。 洗淨，切成片。加水1杯煎成半杯。放涼，過濾後內服..Modern Research:現代 研究﹕Anti-inflammatory effect of Zingiber cassumunar Roxb. and its active principles.Zingiber cassumunar rhizome showed more than 30% increase of CYP3A4 inhibition [1]Inhibits cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2)http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1312247/table/TU1/Toxicity & Cautions:毒素與禁忌﹕Avoid mixing this herb with warfarin, hypertension drugs or cholesterol drugs.[2]避免與抗凝血素香豆素或與治血壓高西藥，或降膽固醇西藥同用。 [1] J Ethnopharmacol. 2006 May 24;105(3):449-55. Name: man tuo luo
angle's trumpet
Other name: nan yang jin hua 南洋金花
shan qie zi 山茄子
feng qie zi 鳳茄花
guangdong nao yang hua 廣東鬧洋花 (not the same as Rhododendron molle G. Don)
feng qie hua 風茄花

Medical Function: The active ingredient scopolamine possesses the anesthesia effect, relaxes muscles, and inhibit secretion of sweat.
Seeds: promoting blood circulation, ridding of pain, dispels wind (袪風).
Dosage: Oral: 0.3–0.6 g. Also used as cigarettes several times per day but not over 1.5 g per day. External application: wash with decoction using appropriate amount or make into paste and apply.
Contraindications:
The whole plant is toxic, especially the seeds. Toxicity is caused by the atropine type of alkaloids. Clinical symptoms include: dry mouth, dry tongue, difficulty in swallowing, excitement, hallucination, flushing without sweat, dilation of pupils, vomiting, dizziness, manic and delirium. Late-stage symptoms include slowing down in breathing, rising body temperature but with cold extremities, spasm, coma and even death.
Large dosages and/or long term usage can be toxic to kidneys.
The antidote to atropine is physostigmine or pilocarpine.
Notes:
Man tuo luo (曼陀羅) flower can inhibit sweat gland secretion; therefore the anesthetic prepared from this flower was called “蒙汗藥” in ancient times.
“鬧洋花” is the flower of Rhododendron molle G. Don; note that the listing “廣東鬧洋花 (not the same as Rhododendron molle G. Don)” appears separately under Other Names.
Chemical Ingredients: Primary tropane alkaloids: atropine, scopolamine, hyoscyamine, apoatropine, daturine, tigloidine.
Additional constituents listed: scopoletin, 曼陀蘿鹼, skimmianine, 2,6-dihydroxyhoscyamine, 紅古豆鹼, 7-羟基-3,6-二惕各酰氧托院.
Seeds and flowers contain the highest concentration of alkaloids, but all parts of the plant are active.
Total alkaloid content is highest during the maturing period of the flowers and rapidly decreases when the seeds are matured.
Original Text:
man tuo luo, angle's trumpet, Complementary and Alternative Healing University     
現代中藥辭典

Pron. in Japanese:

kalu-attana



Pron. in Korean:

mantara



 Pron. 
        in Cantonese:

maan4 to4 lo4



Other Names:
別名﹕


nan yang jin hua 南洋金花﹐shan qie zi 山茄子﹐feng qie 
        zi  鳳茄花﹐guangdong nao yang hua 廣東鬧洋花 (not the same as 
        Rhododendron molle G. Don) 
﹐feng qie hua 風茄花



Common Name:
英文名﹕

Jimson 
        weed, thorn apple, angel's trumpet, devil's trumpet, Jamestown weed, 
        Downy thorn apple.



Distribution:
產地﹕

Mainly produced in Jiangsu, 
        Guangdong, Zhejiang, Anhui provinces of China
主產江蘇， 廣東﹐浙江﹐安徽。




Properties
(characteristics)﹕
性味﹕

very toxic
有劇毒




Channels (meridians) entered:
 
歸經﹕




Medical functions:
藥理﹕
 

The active ingredient scopolamine 
        possesses the anesthesia effect, relaxes muscles, and inhibit secretion 
        of sweat.東莨菪鹼有麻醉作用，可使肌肉鬆馳，抑制汗腺分泌。




Actions 
        & Indications:
主治﹕

The flowers are being used 
        in anaesthesia, as sedative and for inducing sleep. The leaves are being 
        used in rheumatoid arthritis. The seeds are being used in promoting blood 
        circulation and in ridding of pain.花可麻醉止痛﹐鎮 
        靜和催眠;葉可治風濕痛;種子能行血﹐袪風等。




Chemical 
        ingredients:
化學成份﹕

Principal active biochemicals 
        are the primary tropane alkaloids: atropine, and scopolamine, hyoscyamine, 
        atropine, apoatropine, daturine,
        tigloidine . The seeds and flowers contain the 
        highest concentration of alkaloids but all parts of the plant are active. 
        The total alkaloid is highest during the maturing period of the flowers 
        and lower when the seeds are matured. The seeds also contain hemaglutinin.
其主要生物化學成份為顛茄烷生物鹼 (tropane 
        alkaloids)。 主要含東莨菪鹼 (scopolamine﹐scopoletin),莨 
        菪鹼 (hyoscyamine)，其次有阿托品 (atropine),阿 
        朴阿托品（apoatropine）,降 
        阿托品,曼陀羅素 
        （daturine）,惕 
        各酰莨菪鹼（tigloidine）,曼 
        陀蘿鹼,茵 
        芋鹼 (skimmianine), 
        2，6-二 
        惕莨菪鹼（2，6-dihydroxyhoscyamine）,紅 
        古豆鹼和7-羟基-3，6-二 
        惕各酰氧托院。總生物鹼含量開花末期最高，到種子成熟時迅速下降。從種子 還分出血球凝集素。 




Dosage:
用量﹕

To take 
        orally: 0.3～0.6g. Also being used as cigarettes 
        for several times per day but not over 1.5 g per day.
For external application: wash with 
        decoction using appropriate amount or make into paste and apply.
內服：0.3～0.6g；亦可作捲煙燃吸多次。但每 
        日不超過1.5g。外用：煎水洗或研末調敷。




Samples of formulae:
處方舉例﹕

 



Modern 
        Research:
現代研究﹕

 


Toxicity:毒 
        素﹕

The whole plant is toxic, 
        especially the seeds. Its toxicity is caused by the atropin type of akaloids.
Clinical symptoms include: dry mouth, dry tongue, difficulty 
        in swallowing, excitement, hallucination, flushing but without sweat, dilation 
        of pupils, vomiting, dizziness, manic and delirium. The late stage symptoms 
        include slowing down in breathing, rising body temperature but with cold 
        extremities, spasm, coma and even death.

Large dosages and/or long term usage can 
        be toxic 
        to kidneys.
The
        antidote to atropine is physostigmine 
        or pilocarpine
大劑量或長期 
        服用可能對腎 
        臟有毒。
全 
        株植物含根,莖,葉,花皆含有毒素，尤其 種子毒性最強。
其 
        毒性作用主要是來自類似阿托平作用的生物 鹼。臨床症狀在初期會有口 
        乾舌燥, 吞嚥困難,興奮, 幻覺, 皮膚潮紅無汗, 瞳孔散大及嘔吐, 眩暈, 狂躁, 
瞻妄等 
        症狀。晚期會有呼吸慢, 體溫升高但手腳發冷﹐ 
        全身抽搐,昏迷，甚至死亡發生。
大劑量或長期服用可能對腎臟有毒。
解藥可用毛果芸香碱。




Cautions:
禁忌﹕

see toxicity above.
看上條﹕毒素



註：曼 
    陀羅花 
    能抑制汗 
    腺分泌，故古人将此花所制的麻醉药稱之為�蒙汗藥�。
         
    鬧洋花是杜鵑花科植物羊躑躅 Rhododendron molle G. Don 的花。

Name: qian niu zi
牽牛子
Other name: hei chou 黑丑
bai chou 白丑
er chou 二丑
chou niu zi 丑牛子
hei qian niu zi 黑牽牛子
bai qian niu zi 白牽牛子
la ba hua (trumptet flower) 喇叭花

Dosage: 4.5 to 9 g in decoction. 0.3~1.5 g in powder form.
Samples of Formulae:
For edema of limbs and ascites:
Name of formula: qian niu san (pu ji fang)
Composition: qian niu zi (morning glory seed), mu tong (akebia stem), bai zhu (Atractylodes macrocephala rhizome), sang gen bai pi (mulberry root bark), mu xiang (costus root), rou gui (cinnamon bark), chen pi (tangerine peel).
Treats: water swelling of limbs, dysuria with difficult urination, upward qi panting and shortness of breath.

For worm parasites:
Name of formula: qian niu san (Sheng's zhun sheng)
Composition: qian niu zi (morning glory seed), da huang (rhubarb root and rhizome), bing lang (areca nut), xiong huang (realgar).
Treats: parasite accumulation.
Contraindications:
This is a strong herb. Using small amount can help bowel movements. Using large amount can cause heavy diarrhea. It can be used temporary for cough with abundance of phlegm and asthma but do not use for long time or in large amount. Do not use in cases pixu (spleen deficient), qixu (qi deficient) or during pregnancies.
The raw seed is toxic and its smell is pungent and strong, and its laxative effect is drastic. After stir frying, its toxicity is less and the laxative effect is mild. After stir frying, the herb is loose and brittle and easier to smash and easier to decoct to extract the effective ingredients.

Seeds: Pharbitic acid C, D (牽牛子酸丙, 丁)

Original Text:
qian niu zi, Complementary and Alternative Healing University

For

qian 
            niu zi, da huan, bing nang, xiong huang.
牽牛散《普濟方》：牽牛子，木通，白朮，桑根白皮，木香，肉桂，陳皮。治水氣肢體浮腫，大小便澀， 
            上氣喘促。

Modern Research:

現代研究﹕

 




Toxicity & Cautions:

毒素與禁忌﹕

This is a strong herb. 
            Using small amount can help bowel movements. Using large amount can 
            cause heavy diarrhea. It can be used temporary for cough with abundance 
            of phlegm and asthma but do not use for long time or in large amount. 
            Do not use in cases pixu 
            (spleen deficient), 
qixu (qi deficient)
or during pregnancies.The raw seed 
            is toxic and it smell is pungent and strong, and its laxative effect 
            if drastic. After stir frying, it toxicity is less and the laxative 
            effect is mild. After stir frying, the herb is loose and brittle and 
            easier to smash and easier to decoct to extract the effective ingredients.
牽牛子為峻下的藥品，少用
            則通大便，多用則瀉下如水。於用治痰壅氣滯，咳 逆喘滿，則只宜暫用，不可久服。孕婦及
脾虛 或 
            氣虛 者忌服。
生牽牛子有毒，氣味峻烈而瀉下力猛。炒牽牛子之毒性較小，瀉下作用較緩
            和。且炒過後藥材質地變鬆脆，而易於粉碎和煎出有效成分

Name: tu bie chong
Other name: Prescription names: jie chong 蟅蟲
Prescription names: di bie chong 地鱉蟲
Prescription names: tu bie chong 土鱉蟲
Prescription names: tu yan 土元
Di Bie (地鱉, Ben Jing)
Tu Bie (土鱉, Bie Lu)
Guo Jie (過街, Pi Ya)
Bo Ji Chong (簸箕虫, Ben Cao Yan Yi)
Ke Bo Chong (蚵蚾蟲, Xiu Zhen Fang)
Di Bi Chong (地婢虫, Bao Shi Xiao Er Fang)
Shan Zhang Lang (山蟑螂, Ben Cao Qiu Yuan)
Di Wu Gui (地烏龜, Fen Lei Cao Yao Xing)
Tu Yuan (土元, Zhong Yao Xing Xing Jing Yan Jian Bie Fa)
Chou Chong Mu (臭蟲母, Hebei Yao Cai)
Gai Zi Chong (蓋子蟲, Hebei Yao Cai)
Tu Chong (土蟲, Jilin Zhong Cao Yao)
Jie Jie Chong (節節蟲, Jiangsu Yao Cai Zhi)
Ma Yi Hu (螞蟻虎, Jiangsu Yao Cai Zhi)

Maladies Treated:
Blood stasis with amenorrhea.

癥瘕結塊 (zheng jia jie kuai) masses and aggregations.

跌仆傷痛 (injuries from falls and impact) with pain.

筋傷骨折 (tendon injury and bone fracture).

腰部扭傷 (sprain in the loin/waist area).
Samples of Formulae: Being used in leukemia: shen zhu wan (參朮丸).
Contraindications: Do not use in cases of weak body or pregnancies.

Name: tu si zi
Common: English: cuscuta; Chinese dodder seed (英文名)

Maladies Treated: mouth bitterness and dry thirst (口苦躁渴)
Medical Function: Tonifies kidneys, liver and spleen; improves yin; calms fetus

Hepatoprotective effects in carbon tetrachloride injury in mice: 20% water decoction by oral administration at 50 g crude drug/kg body weight lowered blood lactate, pyruvate, and SGPT, and increased glycogen and adrenal ascorbic acid. [2]

Yang-supporting and enhancement of sexual vitality: 20% water decoction 0.5 ml/day orally improved yang deficiency symptoms in mice; culture medium containing tu si zi water decoction at 0.5%, 1.0%, and 2.0% enhanced drosophila sexual vitality. [2]
Increases non-specific resistance: water decoction extended weight-loaded swimming time in mice and enhanced hypoxic tolerance under normal pressure. [2]
Other roles: anti-tumor, anti-viral, anti-inflammatory, anti-infertility, lapactic, and central nervous system suppression. [2]
Samples of Formulae:
For improving sperm quality: Wu Zi Yan Zong Wan (Five-Seed Progeny Pill).

For treatment of threatened abortion: Composition: Tu Si Zi (Chinese dodder seed) + Xu Duan (teasel root / Dipsaci radix) + E Jiao (donkey-hide gelatin) + Dang Shen (codonopsis root) + Bai Zhu (white atractylodes rhizome). Treated 110 patients. Take herb once a day for 10 days. Effective rate: 96.36%.

For treatment of impotence: Tu Si Zi (Chinese dodder seed), She Chuang Zi (cnidium fruit), Wu Wei Zi (schisandra fruit), equal amounts. Grind into powder and mix with cooked honey. Form pills the size of a soybean. Take 30 pills each time, 3 times a day. [3]
Contraindications: not to use in blood deficient and yinxu with fire. 血虛及火熱者忌服。“腎家多火，強陽不痿，大便燥結者忌菟絲子。”《 本草從新 》
Research:
Anti-aging effect. [1]

Hepatoprotective effects: tu si zi20% water decoction on carbon tetrachloride injury in mice: providing orally 50g crude drug / kg body weight, can lower the blood lactate, pyruvate, and SGPT decline, and can increase glycogen adrenal ascorbic acid significantly, and shows the protective activity of damaged liver. [2]

Yang and enhance sexual vitality role: 20% the tu si zi water decoction of 0.5ml /  day orally, corrected yang deficiency symptoms in mice. Culture medium containing the tu si zi water decoction of three concentration 0.5,1. O and 2.O% can enhance the drosophila (fruit flies) sexual vitality. [2]

Increase the role of non-specific resistance: tu si zi water decoction can extend swimming time of mice, enhanced hypoxic tolerance under normal pressure, improve its non-specific resistance. [2]

Other role: tu si zi: anti-tumor, anti-viral, anti-inflammatory, anti-infertility, lapactic, and suppress the central nervous system. [2]
Notes:
Identification test: Take a small amount of this product and soak in sufficient distilled water; the soak becomes yellow, and transparent semi-mucilage can be seen on the surface of the seeds; when rubbed it feels sticky and smooth. Boiling makes it easy to rupture; after rupture a white spiral shape is exposed, resembling silk extrusion. This is genuine tu si zi.

Adulterant note: Counterfeits use “茛菪子” (seeds of a Solanaceae plant) to pass as tu si zi. The counterfeit (dried mature seeds of a Solanaceae plant) are ovate or slightly kidney-shaped, slightly flattened, with a protruding hilum. The surface is grayish-yellow or brownish-yellow; the seed coat is rough with densely raised striations. Odorless and slightly pungent. Using the same identification method, soaking a small amount of seeds in water does not change color.
References: [2] Zhong Hua Ben Cao 中華本草
[3] Qian Jin Fang 千金方；中國時報 第39版 2000.3.15(三)
[1] 殷林茂，等•中西醫結合治療幼小子宮46例•河北中醫1992; 14(4):40 Yan Linmao, ed. Integrating Chinese and western medicine to treat Infantile uterus, Herbal Journal of Traditional Chinese Medicine1992;14(4):40.*

tu si zi, Complementary and Alternative Healing University  現代醫藥詞典

　tu si zi   菟絲子by: Joe Hing Kwok Chu　

Pharmaceutical name:英文药名：Semen Cuscutae ChinensisBiological name:拉丁名：Cuscuta chinensis Lam.,C. japonica ChoisyPron. in Japanese:日語發音：toshishiPron. in Korean:8韩語發音：tosachaPron. in Cantonese: 粤語發音：tou3  si1  zi2Common Name:英文名：cuscuta, Chinese dodder seedDistribution:分佈：Jiangsu, Liaoning, Jiling, Hebei, shandong, Henan provinces of China.江蘇、遼寧、吉林、河北、山東、河南省等地區。Properties (characteristics)：性味：acrid, sweet, neutral辛，甘，平。Channels (meridians) entered:歸經：kidney, liver肝，腎Actions & Indications:主治:tonifies kidneys, liver and spleen, improve yin; for shenyangxu, pixu, neurasthenia, calming fetus, for habitual miscarriage.口苦躁渴，陽痿，遺精，血尿，小便淋瀝，大便溏薄，神經衰弱，習慣性流產。Medical Function:To be editedAnti-aging effect. [1]Hepatoprotective effects: tu si zi20% water decoction on carbon tetrachloride injury in mice: providing orally 50g crude drug / kg body weight, can lower the blood lactate, pyruvate, and SGPT decline, and can increase glycogen adrenal ascorbic acid significantly, and shows the protective activity of damaged liver. [2]  Yang and enhance sexual vitality role: 20% the tu si zi water decoction of 0.5ml /  day orally, corrected yang deficiency symptoms in mice. Culture medium containing the tu si zi water decoction of three concentration 0.5,1. O and 2.O% can enhance the drosophila (fruit flies) sexual vitality. [2]  Increase the role of non-specific resistance: tu si zi water decoction can extend swimming time of mice, enhanced hypoxic tolerance under normal pressure, improve its non-specific resistance. [2]  Other role: tu si zi: anti-tumor, anti-viral, anti-inflammatory, anti-infertility, lapactic, and suppress the central nervous system. [2]具有延緩衰老作用。[1]保肝作用：菟絲子20%的水煎劑給四氯化碳損傷小鼠灌胃，50g生藥/kg體重，能使血液中增加的乳酸、丙酮酸及 SGPT 下降，而使下降的肝糖元和腎上腺抗壞血酸上升，有顯著的保護肝損傷活性。[2]  助陽和增強性活力作用：20%菟絲子水煎劑 0.5ml/隻/天 灌胃，對陽虛小鼠的症狀有一定的恢復作用。用含菟絲子水煎劑的培養基培養，在0.5、1.O和2.O%三個濃度下均能提高果蠅的性活力。[2]  增加非特異性抵抗力作用：菟絲子水煎劑，能延氏小鼠負重游泳時間，增強小鼠在常壓下的耐缺氧能力，提高其非特異性抵抗力。[2]  其它作用：菟絲子尚具有抗腫瘤、抗病毒、抗炎、抗不育、致瀉、及抑制中樞神經系統的作用。[2]Chemical ingredients:化学成分：to be loadedDosage:9 to 15 g.Samples of formulae:


        For improving sperm quality: wu zi yan zong wan

For treatment of threatened abortion: Prescription:  tu zi zi , xu duan, e jiao, dang shen, bai zhu. Treated 110 patients. Take herb once a day for 10 days. Effective rate: 96.36%


For treatment of impotence: 

        tu si zi, 
        she chuang zi, 
 wu wei zi, equal amount, make into 
        powder and mix with cooked honey. Make  into pills like size of 
        soybean. Take 30 pills each time, 3 times a day. [3]


　


        增加精子質量：五子衍宗丸

治療先兆流產的作用：菟絲子與續 斷、阿膠、黨 參、白 朮等配伍，治療先兆流產110例，病人每日服藥一次，共10天，總有效率為96.36%。[1]

治陽痿：菟絲子、蛇床子、五味子各等分。上三味，末之，蜜丸如梧子。飲服三十丸，日三。《方源：千金方 》


Modern Research:to be loadedCautions:not to use in blood deficient  and yinxu with fire. 血虛及火熱者忌服。“腎家多火，強陽不痿，大便燥結者忌菟絲子。”《 本草從新 》[1] 首席医学网      2005年10月09日 14:47:05[2]   Zhong Hua Ben Cao 中華本草
[3] 

Qian Jin Fang 千金方中國時報  第39版  2000.3.15(三)鑑定試驗方法：取本品少量，加準水適量浸泡，浸泡呈黃色，其種子表面可見透明的半粘液，用用捻有粘滑感。煮之易破裂，破裂後露出白色卷旋狀﹐形如吐絲。此才是真品菟絲子。偽品是用「茛菪子」混充使用。按茛菪子屬茄科植物茛菪的乾燥成熟種子偽充菟絲子。該品性狀如卵圖形或略象腎形﹐稍有扁平，臍點處突出。面灰黃色或棕黃色，種皮粗糙，具細密隆起的紋路。無臭味微辛。鑑驗方法同上，取種子少量泡在水中不變色，[1] 殷林茂，等•中西醫結合治療幼小子宮46例•河北中醫1992; 14(4):40 Yan Linmao, ed. Integrating Chinese and western medicine to treat Infantile uterus, Herbal Journal of Traditional Chinese Medicine1992;14(4):40.*
